Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2008 04:48PM nanclee wrote: Christi,  EVERYONE is scared when they hear the words "cancer" & "chemo", and it does take a while for it all to sink in..but it will and then survival mode kicks in.  I just finished my first cycle of chemo (four treatments of A&C) and had no real side effects.  The nausea medicine REALLY helped.  My biggest complaint are the hot flashes during the night. I found that Tylenol PM does help if you find you have trouble sleeping.  My thoughts are with you & everyone who is fighting this disease!
Posts.Title: Chemo is scaring me so badly. Please help me. Mocity nanclee

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2008 08:06PM nanclee wrote: Otter, I think it looks BEAUTIFUL!!  Be proud of it and all you've gone through!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 11:39PM nanclee wrote: Rock Fan, I was also most upset about my hair at first when I first began chemo in Sept, and the week I lost it was probably the most emotional for me...but it gets better. What chemo drugs are you being given?  I had AC x 4, and had my first Taxol yesterday.  I hope all goes well..let me know how things are going.  Nancy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 10:47PM nanclee wrote: Ellzig, I just finished AC x 4, and had my first of four Taxol a week ago.  I had only mild bone pain 2-3 days after my first Taxol, but no other SE's...nothing like AC. I took emend & zofran during AC and experienced no nausea, & my doc said it wouldn't be needed for Taxol..so far he is right. I hope you are as lucky..Nancy
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 11:45PM nanclee wrote: I am getting #2 of 4 Taxol Wednesday (I finished AC x 4 on 10/15) and have had minimal SE's so far with this cycle, just minor bone pain. Hoping this continues.   It has taken me a few months to come to grips with being bald..but I am kinda proud of it now.  My 12 yr-old son is still a little uncomfortable with it, but I guess that is understandable since he is just entering puberty and going through his own issues at the same time!  My co-workers/friends are throwing me a benefit on 11/22 and I'm feeling a little weird about it all...have any of you gone through this??  I work in a restaurant so many of my "regulars" are hearing about it, etc.  Any advice??
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2008 09:17PM nanclee wrote: Roya, I was glad to hear that the Taxol has been easier for you, as I have the exact same chemo cycles as you (4 AC followed by 4 T).  My dr said I would have very little side effects if any..I start my Taxol cycle 10/29.  I experienced slight fatigue and some bone pain immediately following chemo, but no N/V at all. I am curious to see when my hair will begin to grow back. It fell out almost completely in just 5 days beginning 12 days after my first AC treatment.
Posts.Title: 4 rounds of AC and want to skip Taxol lucky8 Springtime
